utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh not the- the spelling is not Y U K I but E U K E.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: E U K E, okay that's-

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes, it's a different spelling of the name Euke.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: How can I help you Euke?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Oh by the way, I'm planning to have a trip to Singapore with my girlfriend this coming the fourth until the sixth of April.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, fourth to the sixth of April.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: But- But I don't know where to go.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I haven't been to Singapore yet.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh may I know are you both in your twenties or thirties?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh what is your budget for coming?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I only have one thousand Singaporean Dollar in my pocket.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Is that for both of you or for just-

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: No, for- just for me, just for myself.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So do you mind if you go to a budget hotel?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh it's fine as long as it's affordable.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And it goes with my budget.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And you can take public transport around Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: We have got very good %uh transportation system by rail.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Mass Rapid Transit and also by buses.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So your thousand dollars could %uh very well %uh be enough for the both of you.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's just for the land arrangement, right?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Oh by the way, how much is the airfare from the Philippines to Singapore?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Airfare, I think there are various airlines %um. You might want to- can you travel on Cebu Air?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Are you able to from where you are?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So how much would it cost for me to go to Singapore?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: I'm on the Cebu Pacific website now or rather I'm trying to get on to it.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh it would be a round trip ticket.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's origin would be- is it Manila?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I prefer a round trip ticket.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Manila and your destination is Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And departure date is the fourth of April.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes, it is the fourth of April.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, just give me a moment.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Oh by the way Ma'am what's your religion?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Many of my Filipino friends are.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I am Catholic too but I don't think if there are Catholic churches in Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: In fact %uh ninety per cent of our choir members are Catholic.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So we depend on them to sing for us.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Oh by the way, from- let's say for example, I already arrived in Singapore airline- %uh airport.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Will you pick me up at the airport?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Oh from the airport, you can easily take the Mass Rapid Transit that we call the MRT.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And you can come to Singapore from there.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: You mean to say that %uh there is no tourist guide that will accompany me from the time we arrived at the airport?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You can but you know you have a limited budget.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: If you get a guide to pick you up and send you to town by limousine and all that, it will be expensive.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's very easy to do a free and easy %uh by yourself when you arrived.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So how much if I add- how much- what if I add %um two thousand Singaporean Dollar for my budget?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Your two thousand dollars, if you're just staying a few days, you could get a car to pick you up from the airport.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Oh so you mean to say that if I have three thousand Singaporean Dollar in my pocket, there is a tourist guide that will pick me up at the airport?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But let- Yes, you can be picked up from the airport.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You can do all your tours privately.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh but let me get back to your %uh question about the fare.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: April the fourth on your screen?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So those are all the flights.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And %uh unfortunately because maybe it's so close to the date-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Um the promotional fares are not available but I can see here six thousand nine hundred and ninety nine dollars.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh for Filipino Peso, I don't know how that got %uh how that connects.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: You mean the conversion, you don't know the conversation?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh I think it's around two thousand or more than two thousand Singaporean Dollar, the value of that.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: But it's fine but- because I really want to travel.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I really want to go to Singapore because I want to see how beautiful it is.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh what part of Singapore are you think- what are your interests?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Actually I'm into- I love animals so I wanna go to the zoo if there is.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Oh which is the best zoo in Singapore?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: We have only one zoo in Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And it's part of an organisation-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And you can visit the zoo in the day.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And then walk to the Night Safari which is just next door.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And you can visit the Night Safari to see the nocturnal animals.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Let me get on their website, huh?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: How much is the fee at the zoo?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh if you buy a ticket for all the attractions, it's much cheaper.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: How far will I go with a thousand Singaporean Dollar in my pocket?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh it's %uh it depends on where you stay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: If you don't spend a lot on your %uh hotel accommodation

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: you'll be able to visit a lot of places.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I can go anywhere with that- with a thousand dollars?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, you can get hotels about a hundred over dollars.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You can get hotels at a thousand over dollars.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Um if you save on the accommodation, then you have more money to visit attractions.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And %uh if you don't take the taxis and you don't hire a private guide, then you use public transport, you save a lot of money.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So for example you will tour me, alright?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So you will be my tour guide because I don't know anything about your culture, your customs.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So I might get lost also because I think it's a big country.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: However if you will tour me in Singapore, how many hours per day will you be with me?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You haven't been around- you haven't been to Singapore before, right?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So normally we do a city tour where we bring you to the ethnic areas.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And the Malay Quarter if you like where we have an old mosque.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And these are the heritage areas where the buildings are conserved for future generations to enjoy.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: We would also bring you to the historic area by the Singapore river.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Where we have %um the Merlion which is the symbol of Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And you can in fact take a riverboat ride in the bay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's very scenic and it's very good for photography.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So on the tour, we would tell you things about Singapore like the population.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh that we have a mixed culture of Chinese, Malays and Indians we have.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: You tour me in different places in Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Can I took pictures or are we allowed to take pictures?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, I think it's only in the airport that it is %uh restricted.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh so usually you can take pictures.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's just that if you are in a place of worship like a temple or a mosque %um it's better to ask for permission from somebody who seems to be in charge.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So that you know, officially you've got permission.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh usually we don't take pictures of people who are praying but of the architecture.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: But do you have do's and don'ts for a tourist like me?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh do you have any do's or don'ts for a tourist like me?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh do's or don'ts %um generally you don't smoke where there's a non-smoking area like in the restaurant.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: They have only a certain part of the place where you can smoke.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: De~ there's a designated area and it says that you can smoke.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So it's limited to a very small percentage of the total area of the restaurant.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Alright, can- for example I brought my phone with me and then can I use my phone while we were sort of touring or touring like with %uh-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh sorry, you want to use your phone while you are touring, you can.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But you can't use- if you hired a car, you can't use your phone and %uh drive at the same time.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay, what is the best travel secret you can divulge to me?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh I say get a train pass and then Google for places when you're in Singapore and pick up the tourist brochures on arrival when you are at the airport.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So that even if you don't have a computer you can look at the brochures and you can have a quick look at what you like and don't like.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And then we have %uh people at the airport that can tell you how you can get there.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh if that will save you a lot of money because you don't have to hire a cab.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You don't have to actually hire me as a guide.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Or private car because hiring someone privately will cost you more money.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Alright, so- because I think that once I get in where I book for a trip to Singapore, you will tour me there.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh so it shows to me that it happens in a different way.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You- %uh you can plan it also before you go.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Let me try and get these parks for you.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It was a bit slow downloading.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Because I really do love animals.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Actually here in the Philippines, I went to different zoos.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: I think it's about forty five dollars or forty dollars that you can pay to visit the Bird Park or the zoo and the Night Safari.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And because you are, you know, short of time-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %uh you- I suggest that you visit the Bird Park on one day at the same day that you do your city tour or- you know you travel- you can travel by yourself to Little India- and the ma~

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I can see here that the tour rate for- or in the zoo is only eighteen dollars.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But you see the three in one special there?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's fifty eight dollars and you visit all three.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh I think I will my girlfriend and I would prefer %uh three in one-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: The Night Safari and the zoo are located next to each other.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And you just walk across the car park.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you can visit the zoo in the afternoon.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, and then walk across the Night Safari.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And then if you're energetic and you want to have one whole day for something else-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You could go to the Bird Park first in the morning.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Because %uh this is my plan on our first day we'll go to the zoo.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So here's the thing %uh I will be for the three in one package.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh because zoo is in Singapore so it's only fifty eight dollars.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But %eh Could you speak a bit louder please?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I- on the first day, we decided to go to the zoo.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So I prefer to take the three in one package-

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So in the morning, we'll go to Jurong Bird Park %um in the afternoon-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: I can guess you said morning you're going to the Bird Park.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Afternoon to the zoo and the Night Safari in the evening.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Then on the second day, because I really love the sea, I wanna go swimming right there.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh okay, I lose you now and then.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So when you go to the Bird Park, you buy the three in one ticket.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh normally I think you have a month to use it up.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But you can use it up within a day, it's not a problem.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh if you are tired by the time you reached the Night Safari or the zoo, you can take a tram ride.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But it's really nice to walk around these places.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And you just have to remember to keep your three in one ticket the minute you buy it.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay, so I will take note of that.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um and then I think if- because it's a big day.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: You see, we will go into the Bird Park in the morning.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: The Singapore Zoo in the afternoon.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So for sure we will be-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Oh you're okay, you are back.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So for sure we will be hungry on that time.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Now, where in your place- where's the best place to have dinner around Singapore?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh actually if you are going to walk from the zoo to the Night Safari you will have a limited choice of places to eat. You-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: you will have a limited choice of places to eat. You- I suggest you eat inside the Night Safari.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Oh there are restaurants inside the Night Safari?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, there are restaurants and there are like burger places if you don't want to eat a full meal.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Because to do the three in one, you are a little bit limited in time.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you might want to leave your eating for the next day.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Oh what about if we bring- what about if we bring food while %um roaming the zoo or the park, are we allowed to do it?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, you are allowed to do it.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh we have also fast food outside so if you want to buy and-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: while you're walking around the zoo, you nibble on the food, it's fine.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: it's okay if we bring the food that we buy in the fast food restaurant.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So it's fine to bring it inside.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's fine, it's not a problem.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh it's just that you should be aware that you shouldn't leave litter around.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So it's one of the prohibitions in your country that we don't have to litter anywhere, right?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You should try and keep our places clean and usually people do adhere to that rule.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So what if I don't know any rules about that?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I'm throwing pieces of litter every- anywhere?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Usually the places, there are signs to remind you not to litter and usually it's at places where you eat.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh so that you are mindful and there will be lots of bins around for you.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes, because it's- actually we- I am aware that Singapore is the cleanest city in the world.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh well one of the cleanest cities.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: I won't say it is the cleanest.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh we do have a lot of cleaners to pick up after ourselves actually.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And oh by the way, on the second day-

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I prefer to go to the beach.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You want to go to the beach?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: would you mind to look for nice beaches in your country?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: I think one of the nicest beaches is on Sentosa.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And this beach actually has a Filipino name, it's Siloso Beach.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Siloso means jealous, right? Or jealousy.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Siloso means jealous, right? Or jealousy.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: We are not sure how that name came about.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh but we do have %uh very good views here, I'll show you, of the beach.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: If you get into the island %uh there's no charge for swimming except if you use the lockers.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Wow, it's a very nice place.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh and the- you know it's safe.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I think it's very romantic when I- when we go there.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, indeed it is very romantic.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And %uh you can also stay until the night time.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But if you don't want to spend so much money, there are also %uh food stalls or rather shops that sell food that is not very expensive.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Alright, so how much is a one day stay in that beach?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: The beach, when you enter the island, it's a two dollar charge.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And another dollar for public bus.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And one dollar if you take the public bus in which I suspect you will need to after on your visit to all the parks you'll be a bit tired.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh and then on the beach, it's free.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: But I'm asking if the beach is free?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So if we will rent the cottage?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So- how much would it cost?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Oh- we don't have a cottage.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: We usually just set up a place underneath the coconut tree or %uh some people even just-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %uh hang out at where the food places are.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Oh really so that's how you do it?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, because we- it's, you know, it's very open.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh maybe if the sun is out, it's a bit warm.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So we try and hide under the shelter of some trees.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Alright, because I thought it's %um Sentosa is a resort.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah, there are resort hotels there.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But usually for the resort hotels, you stay in the hotels-

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes, for- what about if we stay there for an- we stay overnight there so how much would it cost?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You would have to stay at the hotels.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh that would burst your budget a little bit.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: The hotels are a few hundred dollars.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh then you might want to stay at the nice hotels there and you can just come out and swim.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh yes, I mean if you're checking in to the hotels, you are staying at the hotels on Sentosa.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You are staying on the island in the hotels.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So then after that, so we're done with the second day.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: We will go to the beach, so here's the thing on the third day.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I really love literature, so I love reading books.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Books. You want to go to the museum or you want to buy books?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Books. You want to go to the museum or you want to buy books?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I want to go to the museum if there is any.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh did you say museum %uh on books?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: No, I- what I said was I love reading books so- and I'm into literature so I want to go to museum and-

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And I want to look for beautiful artefacts-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, are you getting the resort now?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So these are the hotels that are available on the ho~ on the island So that's quite different from a budget hotel.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So it's- how much would it cost for- upon arriving?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Let me- Let me try to get it for you, huh.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: On the fourth you're coming in.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Is that- Sorry, I thought it's the fourth.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes, because on the fourth we will go to the zoo, right?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: No, but if you want to stay at the hotel, don't you want to stay- you mean you want to change hotels?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh it's fine if we arrived there on the fourth.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So the fourth is the first day then?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And %uh you are departing on the?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: After we go to the museum.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So let's see if it's available first.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You may not want to go anywhere once you stay in this hotel.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Because it's well-ventilated and the scenes are- the scenes outside are really nice so I prefer to stay rather than roaming around.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So okay, these are the rates at the moment.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Which is actually quite attractive, five hundred and seventy dollars.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So it's two eight five a day.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: For a resort hotel, I think it's very affordable.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Oh alright so I think %um I will choose that, the resort in Sentosa.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And you wanted a museum, right?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: I give you one of our nice museums.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Alright, could you tell me %eh something about the history of Singapore?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: We- well, we have been- for years %uh thought of as a- just a fishing village until the British came-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And %uh we became a colony until 1942 when the Japanese arrived and occupied Singapore until 1945.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But recent archaeological diggings have found that in fact there was trade here over a thousand years ago.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So we do have an earlier history that we are not very %uh familiar with because of the lack of written history.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: In China, there are some records.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Now, what's the best delicacy in Singapore?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Um are you thinking of Chinese or- Indian?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Or the famous- what's the famous cuisine?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's the rice- the chicken is cooked in- boiled in soup.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And some of the- or rather the water of the soup for boiling the chicken is used for cooking the rice.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And a little bit of oil is added.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So the rice is fragrant and it's oily and we put in the pandan's leaf.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: I think you're familiar with that.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: But- %uh so you mean to say that to prepare it %um a chef would prefer to mix it all together the rice and the chicken?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh he cooks the chicken and then he cook- he takes out the chicken and he cooks the rice separately %uh with the stock that he's used to cook the chicken.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Alright, so what happened to the meat of the chicken?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So when you order %uh he will chop up the portion you like whether it's the thigh, the wing or the breast.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Is there a sauce where I can dip it?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: There's a thick %uh good quality black sauce, Chinese black sauce.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And there are some restaurants that you give %uh grated ginger.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So maybe not if you're with your girlfriend, it might be a bit stinky after that.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Now, is there a restaurant which offers Filipino cuisine?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: There's one in the East Coast.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh a place called East Coast Road.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And if you come on %uh Saturday, Sunday %uh most Filipinos are at the place called Lucky Plaza.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And there on the fourth or fifth floor, there are %uh places selling Filipino food.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But I wouldn't categorise them as being restaurants.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh because they are more the Filipino people so it's quite affordable prices.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So there is no restaurants which is owned by a Filipino and caters Filipino cuisine?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: These places, they are I think owned by Filipinos and %uh it's just that they're not high-end, you get what I mean?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh and- well I personally know of people who get Filipinos to cook for their parties.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And they just do it on a personal basis but they charge for it.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Alright then I'm also into movies so %uh do you have- what's this?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Do you also have- do you also have like that?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Can I just show you the museums first?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Because you're asking me the website that has come out here.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So we have- %uh in the museums, we also have sometimes temporary exhibits from other countries %uh that come in.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Like we have textiles, do you see here?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: From India and- let me see.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: That's up to June so it will be here when you are here.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And we have tank shipwreck gold and ceramic, you see what I mean?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: The shipwreck that was found off Indonesia has got a lot of items there that shows that there's trade in this region %uh that passed through Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So you mean to say when we arrived there and we go to the museum, we will be able to see the- some artefact from India and China?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And the permanent exhibits, we also have artefacts from India.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: The ones you see here are special exhibitions that are here for a short period only So they're very special.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: But I think we won't be able to- oh yes, I- we still be able to watch the tank shipwreck and then the patterns of Indian.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Much as the trade of India.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So will be- aside from these special exhibitions, what other artefacts would we see or would be seen in the museum?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's- %Uh there is one with art and craft from Sarawak Jewellery %uh and %uh bas~ woven clothings that the villagers used to make.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh part of the exhibit is on loan from a collector who went into the jungle and bought up the items.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: That's one of my favourite places also.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And we have another museum, this one is called Peranakan

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's a mix of Chinese and Malay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Alright, now I'm gonna ask you %um are you single?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Now I think%um you are the best person to ask.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Oh where do you usually go with your husband?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Oh we sometimes walk along the bay, you know, by the Singapore river.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And then we stop and have a sandwich or have ice cream.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: There are lots of joints along the Singapore river.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And I- and I think that should be more romantic while walking along the bay with your husband while holding hands, right?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I prefer that it would be very romantic instead of %uh going to the zoo %um watching artefacts in the museum or swimming on the swimming in the beach.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I think I prefer that one, walking along the bay %hm.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh you could visit the earlier museum-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: museum I told you, the Asian Civilisations Museum.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh so if you have time and you want to squeeze in two museums I suggest you go to the Peranakan and then the Asian Civilisations.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And then in the evening, you could walk by the river.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So it's cooler, it's very nice.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So from the- what's the name of the museum again?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: The one where you see the tank exhibits.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So from the Asian Civilisation Museum, how do I get to the river- Singapore river?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: When you come out, you're looking at it.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: When you come out of the museum, you're looking at the river.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Oh I will be able to see it at once?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And you can also see the Merlion but the Merlion is crowded with tourists So if you walk the other way %uh you cross the river, you walk down there.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh what do you mean the Merlion?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: The Merlion is the emblem of Singapore %uh tourism.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: The one that's half-fishtail and half-lion's head.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: That's at the mouth of the river.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes, and it- It has %uh what's this?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: It is- there is a water flowing on its mouth?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh that's also a nice place to walk, it's just that it's not very quiet.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's- you can see the bay, you can see %um the Marina Bay Sands Hotel which has become very iconic.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh lovely views that are very %uh attractive for courting couples.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: I often see a lot of them there.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And %uh it's a long day of travel I guess or a vacation so %uh

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: would- could you bring me or could you send me to the finest restaurant in Singapore?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You could go to the %uh Swissotel The Stamford.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And it's also within the area, you go to the top of the hotel.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's used to be called The Westin Stamford.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And right at the top where you get very good views.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You could also stay there if you wanted to.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, if you look at the map here.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh where you see this dot is the hotel.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And your museum is just a little bit further down.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Just down here and that's the river here.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh the little blue patch on your right.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So let me see if they have the hotel- the restaurant here.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: How much is the taxi fare to this?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh taxi fare, you mean from where?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: From the hotel to the museum.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Oh %uh which hotel did you say you wanted to stay at?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh the one on the hotel- at %uh Sentosa, right?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: The hotel in- from- in Sentosa.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: the hotel would actually have a %uh shuttle into town.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Oh- Oh they do, so s~

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Um I'm not sure if they stop you right there but where this- where Swissotel is %uh they have- you see- can you see the restaurant now on your screen?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: It's quite %um- wow, I can see the view outside.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And they also have convention facilities.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: But- so as you mentioned earlier, the hotel in Sentosa has a shuttle.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: But you don't- you are not sure if the shuttle drops off %um in the museum, right?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: They may if you ask the concierge.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: They might be able to accommodate you.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But I know they will drop off in the town area like Orchard Road and also where there's dining places.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Because these are major areas %uh for shopping.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So %um is the travel fare for the shuttle included in the hotel accommodation?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: The shuttle %uh to get into the hotel is just one dollar.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: the accommodation in the Sentosa Resort is %um five hundred eighty Singaporean Dollars, right?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So does it include the shuttle fare?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: I- no, I don't think they bring you right to the hotel.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You would have to pay extra for the shuttles.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: The transfer- you're talking about transfer from the hotel, right?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You are talking about from the hotel when you arrived at the airport?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: How far would I get there %um- how far would I get to Sentosa Hotel from the airport?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You can get to just across the island at %uh HarbourFront.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So how many minutes would it take?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: By the public transport, maybe forty minutes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes or- yah, that's because you have to make a change and I'm %uh putting in extra for you asking for directions and all that.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It would be less than one hour.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Alright, but as you mentioned all the fares in zoo, the hotel accommodation, for the hotel accommodation and then the museum I think I can go far with the one thousand Singaporean Dollar I have in my pocket.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, you will go very far because you're staying only two nights.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %uh you might have to top-up a bit for your expensive dinner.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: But for the tour itself, I prefer to- I have %um a thousand Singaporean Dollar budget for- just the- for the tour.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh %uh excluding the food allowance or the air fare?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So only for the travel itself.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I think from the %uh what I mean is only for the tour itself.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh a thousand dollar- Singaporean Dollar is enough.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Because as you mentioned that I can enter the zoo for around sixty five to seventy five Singaporean Dollars, right?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: For- Yah, that's for three- all three attractions, the zoo, the Bird Park and the Night Safari.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: For tour attractions, it's a little over forty dollars I think.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: But %um I prefer to go for the three attractions in the zoo.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And then for the museum, I think it won't cost much.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You go on the next day in the morning free and easy after you wake up.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Because it's a public %uh what's this?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Building so it's a public architecture so it's- I think for free.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You will have to pay %Uh it depends if there is a special exhibit on, I believe it's eight dollars or so.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: If you're a senior citizen, you get a lot of discounts but you're not.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: My nationality is not Singaporean so-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Even if you're a foreigner, you get the discount.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I need to pay for that.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I think it won't cost me much.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Alright, so before- %uh so after our tour %uh will you- what's this?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Will you go with us to the airport after the three-day tour?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh if you hire my services, you have to pay for my services.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But like I said you could %uh easily find your way to the airport and just check in.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's- well Singapore is very safe, you don't really need %uh for a departure.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Because I was thinking that I will- I'll be needing a tourist guide and he will show me in this place or this or that.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So I can go all by myself.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes you can but of course you can also hire the services of a guide.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Alright, so I think I got all the information I need.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So it's nice to meet you Miss Jeanne, is it- am I right?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But I keep thinking I'm speaking to a Japanese.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: I really hope to see you with your girlfriend in Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So Miss Jeanne, thank you very much for accommodating my travel plan to Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And I wish to see you there.
